context:
They ARE NOT only just now found in the U.S.:
Animal Planet last year showed a re-run of an episode they had on the hornets, which was originally aired several years ago.  
At that time:
-These hornets had been a serious problem for years in Japan; they were responsible for more deaths annually than those caused by all other predators, including in the surrounding seas.
Their population of was then alarmingly increasing, although there are, in Japan, some natural insect controls opposing them. (Japanese honeybees have found a means to herd-smother individual scouts, but not a horde.)
-Europe has had a serious problem with these for several years.
-The show reported that they had been found near Chicago in 2012.  
( I suspect the climate there was no more hospitable to them than it is to humans.)
